org.eclipse.keyple.transaction

Class SeSelection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.keyple.transaction.SeSelection

  • public final class SeSelection
extends java.lang.Object
    The SeSelection class handles the SE selection process.

    It provides a way to do explicit SE selection or to post process a default SE selection.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SeSelection(SeReader seReader)
      Initializes the SeSelection

    • Constructor Detail

      • SeSelection

        public SeSelection(SeReader seReader)
        Initializes the SeSelection
        Parameters:
        seReader - the reader to use to make the selection

    • Method Detail

      • prepareSelection

        public MatchingSe prepareSelection(SeSelectionRequest seSelectionRequest)
        Prepare a selection: add the selection request from the provided selector to the selection request set.

        Create a MatchingSe, retain it in a list and return it. The MatchingSe may be an extended class

        Parameters:
        seSelectionRequest - the selector to prepare
        Returns:
        a MatchingSe for further information request about this selector

      • processDefaultSelection

        public boolean processDefaultSelection(SelectionResponse selectionResponse)
        Parses the response to a selection operation sent to a SE and sets the selectedSe if any

        The returned boolean indicates if at least one response was successful.

        If one of the response also corresponds to a request for which the channel has been asked to be kept open, then it is retained as a selection answer.

        Responses that have not matched the current SE are set to null.

        Parameters:
        selectionResponse - the response from the reader to the DefaultSelectionRequest
        Returns:
        boolean true if a SE was selected

      • processExplicitSelection

        public boolean processExplicitSelection()
                                 throws KeypleReaderException
        Execute the selection process.

        The selection requests are transmitted to the SE.

        The process stops in the following cases:

        • All the selection requests have been transmitted
        • A selection request matches the current SE and the keepChannelOpen flag was true

        The returned boolean indicates if at least one response was successful.

        If one of the response also corresponds to a request for which the channel has been asked to be kept open, then it is retained as a selection answer.

        Responses that have not matched the current PO are set to null.

        Returns:
        boolean true if a SE was selected
        Throws:
        KeypleReaderException - if the requests transmission failed

      • getSelectedSe

        public MatchingSe getSelectedSe()
        Returns the MatchingSe if there is one, null if not
        Returns:
        a MatchingSe or null

      • getMatchingSeList

        public java.util.List<MatchingSe> getMatchingSeList()
        Returns the updated list of prepared MatchingSe updated with the responses to the selection requests sent.
        Returns:
        a list of MatchingSe

      • getSelectionOperation

        public DefaultSelectionRequest getSelectionOperation()
        The SelectionOperation is the DefaultSelectionRequest to process in ordered to select a SE among others through the selection process. This method is useful to build the prepared selection to be executed by a reader just after a SE insertion.
        Returns:
        the DefaultSelectionRequest previously prepared with prepareSelection
